newsitem.title: USA: PacifiCorp plans choice for some Ore. buyers.
newsitem.headline: PacifiCorp plans choice for some Ore. buyers.

text.p: PacifiCorp said Monday it will file with Oregon regulators to allow its large industrial customers in the state to choose their power supplier.
The plan would also give all customers in Klamath Falls, Ore., the option of choosing to buy power from other sellers, the company said in a statement.
If the open access plans are approved by the Oregon Public Utility Commission, they would go into effect early next year, the company said.

While transitional issues still need to be resolved, PacifiCorp said it now plans to aggressively move forward with retail competition even without federal legislation mandating that all utilities open their service areas.
PacifiCorp serves 1.4 million retail customers in seven western states including Oregon.
In 1998, the company's California customers will be allowed to choose their power provider under that state's restructuring law.
Montana is allowing large industrial customers to choose power suppliers beginning next July.
